m_szDocTitle: A collapsing fossil fuel industry is the 'greatest risk to the global economy' - Business Insider
m_szDocSumamry: textArticle -------------------- REUTERS/Daniel   LeClair One of the oil industry's most trusted advisors says that the   "greatest risk to the global economy today" is not Brexit, the   slowdown in China, or terrorism, but the potential collapse of   the fossil fuels industry. Speaking at the Financial Times' Energy Transformation Strategies   conference in London on Wednesday, Phillip Lambert of boutique   advisory firm Lambert Energy, said that he believes that moving   towards renewable energy sources while ignoring the fossil fuels   sector could be disastrous for the world.
